qas.question: What type of weapon can be used against hovering helicopters?
When an RPG is fired at a steep angle, who is in danger?
An RPG fired at a steep angle has what reflecting off the ground?
What did some militia members in Somalia weld in the exhaust of the RPG tube to protect the shooter?
What were the Somalian militia members firing RPGs at?

context: <a0_0>Rocket-propelled grenades<a0_0/> can be—and often are—used against hovering helicopters (e.g., by Somali militiamen during the Battle of Mogadishu (1993)). Firing an RPG at steep angles poses a danger to <a1_0>the user<a1_0/>, because <a2_0>the backblast<a2_0/> from firing reflects off the ground. In Somalia, militia members sometimes welded <a3_0>a steel plate<a3_0/> in the exhaust end of an RPG's tube to deflect pressure away from the shooter when shooting up at <a4_0>US helicopters<a4_0/>. RPGs are used in this role only when more effective weapons are not available.
